thread.title: Oct 8 TV Picks: ‘How to Get Away with Murder’
thread.title_full: Oct 8 TV Picks: ‘How to Get Away with Murder’ | The Seattle Times

author: Doug Knoop
title: Oct 8 TV Picks: ‘How to Get Away with Murder’
text:
‘How to Get Away with Murder’ This twisty murder mystery series is doing well in its second season. The cast is led by new Emmy-winner Viola Davis as criminal law professor Annalise Keating. Her students (Alfred Enoch, Jack Falahee, Aja Naomi King, Matt McGorry and Karla Souza) continue to be involved in all aspects of her life. 10 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 8, on ABC.

Doug Knoop: dknoop@seattletimes.com or on Twitter @dougknoop 

Also on Thursday Most Read Stories Amid drought, Rattlesnake Lake reveals its roots Probe of 777 engine’s explosive failure pinpoints its origin Lloyd McClendon’s status is at the top of the new Mariners GM’s list Seattle-area teen loved football, says grieving father SEC adds millions to developer’s alleged fraud in Seattle Unlimited Digital Access. $1 for 4 weeks. “The Vampire Diaries,” 8 p.m. (The CW): Damon is faced with a new reality without the love of his life; Bonnie decides to be Damon’s moral compass, and looks out for Alaric, who lost his fiancee; Stefan protects the town from Lily; Enzo must decide who he is loyal to.
“Chopped,” 8 p.m. (Food): Bizarre foods will be found in all the baskets; in the first round, a strange bird part and a stinky young fruit; the entree round features some very hot candies and ugly offal; something purple and something fermented in the dessert round.
“The Blacklist,” 9 p.m. (NBC): With Ressler in hot pursuit, Liz only has Red to trust; Red asks a lawyer named Marvin Gerard for help with a hostage situation; the FBI wants to force Cooper out of the task force.
“Sleepy Hollow,” 9 p.m. (Fox): Crane and Abbie are forced to face their pasts in surprising ways when a new form of evil is unleashed.
“House Hunters International,” 10:30 p.m. (HGTV): A public relations guru has decided to split his time between Hollywood and Puerto Vallarta, Mexico, but may have to sacrifice view for price.
“Miss Fisher’s Murder Mysteries,” 10:34 p.m. (KCTS): Phryne and Jack find buried treasure, pirate ghosts and murder in Queenscliff.
The New York Times
